I'm sure I deserve this ban, but again, I was allowing my "Toxic friend" log onto my account and play a game. Though the weird thing is that he was supposed to be unbanned today, so I don't know why he asked me to play. I guess this is one of the worlds mysteries. ://

replies.body:
I can imagine that it is very frustrating to find yourself being punished for the actions of another person, but all things considered, you are quite lucky that it was just a temporary ban and not a permaban.  Riot has a zero tolerance policy towards hate speech, and many accounts are immediately permabanned for using slurs this many times in a match.  Also, account sharing is against the ToS, and can also get you a permban on the account.  

Situations like this, where a player has an account, but is not the one who actually commits the behavioral infractions, are one of the big reasons why account sharing is not allowed (the other being boosting).  It would be far too easy for players to say "but it wasn't me" any time they were punished, if players were allowed to share accounts.  So, Riot made it part of the policy that players are never to share their accounts, and players are ultimately responsible for anything that happens on their accounts.  

It might not seem very fair, but my advice would be to try and be glad that you weren't punished more harshly, and to definitely never let anyone else use your account again in the future.

1. account sharing isn't allowed so that alone is cause for a perma-ban. 
2. you are responsible for your account and what is said on it, sadly even when hacked sometimes or shared in this case.
3. You are so dang lucky you didn't get permabanned for account sharing
